LineItemTitle.val: Common Aviation Command and Control System (CAC2S)

Description.val: Common Aviation Command and Control System (CAC2S) - A coordinated modernization effort to replace the existing aviation command and control equipment of the Marine Air Command and Control System (MACCS) and to provide the Aviation Combat Element (ACE) with the necessary hardware, software, equipment, and facilities to effectively command, control, and coordinate aviation operations. The CAC2S system will accomplish the MACCS missions with a suite of operationally scalable modules to support the Marine Air Ground Task Force (MAGTF), Joint, and Coalition Forces. The CAC2S integrates the functions of aviation command and control into an interoperable system that will support the core competencies of all Marine Corps warfighting concepts. The CAC2S, in conjunction with the MACCS organic sensors (AN/TPS-63, AN/TPS-59, and AN/TPS-80 (Ground/Air Task Oriented Radar (G/ATOR)) and weapon system Composite Tracking Network (CTN) will provide enhanced air control, improved situational awareness, sensor integration (G/ATOR and AN/TPS-59), full Tactical Data Link integration, airspace and battle planning and command functionality as well as sensor netting integration (Composite Tracking Network (CTN)). CAC2S, with these organic MACCS programs, support the tenets of Expeditionary Maneuver Warfare and fosters joint interoperability. CAC2S Increment I replaces legacy aviation command and control systems in the following Marine aviation agencies: Direct Air Support Center (DASC), Tactical Air Command Center (TACC), and Tactical Air Operations Center (TAOC).

Justification.val:
FY 2019 ($32.587M):

Funds procured tactical voice/data radios associated with the CAC2S MRQ-13 Communications System (CS) refresh/upgrade. The CS was originally fielded in FY 2006 and has been sustained and repurposed to provide CAC2S operators access to tactical radios required to communicate with aircraft and external agencies. The CS is a High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle (HMMWV) mounted shelter containing voice over internet protocol (VoIP) networking/intercom components and tactical radios that enables remote communications access and control from laptop computers within the CAC2S operations facility/tent. The seventy-seven (77) CS vehicles associated with CAC2S currently retain 2006 era radios. These obsolete radios must be replaced to meet NSA crypto modernization mandates and enable CAC2S to maintain voice/data interoperability with joint forces. FY 2019 funds made available through the FY 2018 Should Cost initiative allowed accelerated procurement of tactical radios for the CS refresh/upgrade to occur beginning 1 year ahead of schedule. Accelerated procurement of the tactical radios increases CS interoperability, reliability and sustainability and enable CAC2S to meet NSA crypto modernization mandates as the legacy/obsolete CS radios and networking components are replaced with modern, readily supportable communications equipment. All required AN/PRC-160 radios were procured to support all 77 CS units, and 47% of the required AN/PRC-158 radios were procured which will enable the program to outfit 36 CS units.
The FY 2019 budget also supports the procurement of the Multi-function Information Distribution System (MIDS) Block II upgrade required to comply with DoD frequency remapping and NSA crypto modernization mandates by FY 2020.


FY 2020 ($30.812M):

In FY 2020, CAC2S will continue with the procurement of radios and voice networking/intercom components associated with the AN/MRQ-13 Communications System (CS) refresh/upgrade. The CS upgrade/refresh consists of the procurement of 2 variants of tactical radios and radio auxiliary support equipment, and various voice networking/intercom components which will replace the current obsolete voice/data communications components with modernized equipment that is more reliable, readily supportable and cyber-secure. In FY 2020, CAC2S will procure all required AN/PRC-158 Radios to upgrade all quantity 77 AN/MRQ-13 CS units. The funding will also be utilized to initiate the procurement of voice over internet protocol (VoIP) networking/intercom components and continue to procure auxiliary radio support equipment.
Funding in FY 2020 will also continue to support AN/TSQ-297 CAC2S Full Deployment Unit (FDU) fielding and associated, on-site new equipment training (NET) that is provided with CAC2S deliveries to the operating forces.  Supports installation of engineering changes that require integration upon initial delivery of the production systems.


FY 2021 Base Appropriation ($35.057M):

Funds will complete the procurement of the CAC2S MRQ-13 Communications System (CS) refresh/upgrade. FY 2021 funding will continue the procurement of the required voice over internet protocol (VoIP) networking/intercom components and radio auxiliary support equipment required to interface with the tactical radios. These upgraded CS units will provide CAC2S improved voice/data networks and interoperability with joint forces and will eliminate obsolescence issues associated with the legacy VoIP components. FY 2021 was increased by $2.006M from the FY 2020 request to the FY 2021 request. This will support the integration of the CS voice communications components.

The $4.245M increase from FY 2020 to FY 2021 is to support the procurement of voice communications components and voice over internet protocol (VoIP) networking/intercom components required to complete the refresh/upgrade of the AN/MRQ-13 CS.

Name.val: Common Aviation Command and Control System (CAC2S)

FiscalYear.@footnote: Total System AAO = 50 as reflected on the P5.  4 PY refurbished assets not reflected on P5a.

Name.@footnote: The CAC2S (V)1 variant is fielded to Tactical Air Operations Centers (TAOC), Early Warning & Control (E/WC) detachments and Direct Air Support Centers (DASC) agencies.

The AN/TSQ-297(V)2 variant is equipped with a tent-based operations facility providing 176 operator workstations. The CAC2S (V)2 variant is fielded to each Marine Aircraft Wing's Tactical Air Command Center (TACC).

The AN/TSQ-297(V)3 variant is operationally the same as the (V)1 variant, but is not equipped with tactical vehicles and tents. The CAC2S (V)3 variant is fielded to the supporting establishment and Military Occupational Specialty producing schools.

The CS upgrade/refresh consists of 2 variants of tactical radios, voice over internet protocol (VoIP) networking/intercom components, and radio auxiliary support equipment. The CS upgrade replaces 2006 era, obsolete voice/data communications components with modernized equipment that is more reliable, readily supportable and cyber-secure, enabling integration with CAC2S networks and interoperability with joint forces. The AN/MRQ-13 CS refresh/upgrade components improve CS interoperability, reliability, and sustainability while enabling CAC2S to meet NSA crypto modernization mandates as the legacy/obsolete CS radios and networking components are replaced with modern, readily supportable communications equipment. FY20 funding will complete the procurement of all required AN/PRC 158 Radio Support Equipment and AN/PRC-158 Radios to upgrade all seventy-seven (77) AN/MRQ-13 CS units. The $9.576M increase from FY 2020 to FY 2021 supports the procurement of voice communications components and voice over internet protocol (VoIP) networking/intercom components required to complete the refresh/upgrade of the seventy-seven (77) CS vehicles.
Global Positioning System - Miniature Precision Lightweight GPS Receiver (PLGR) Engine - Selective Availability Anti-spoofing Module (SAASM) (GPS - MPE-S).
Name.val: 2.1.2) GPS - MPE-S (See ACRN defined in P5 Remarks)

Name.@footnote: MIDS radios provide the primary means to exchange Tactical Data Link (TDL-J) air battlespace information among joint and coalition aviation command and control agencies and aircraft.
A reduction of $2.798M from FY 2020 to FY 2021 is due to the completion of fielding of all CAC2S Full Deployment Units (FDUs) in FY 2020.
A reduction of $2.533M from FY 2020 to FY 2021 is due to the completion of NET in FY 2020 as result of the AN/TSQ-297 CAC2S FDU being fully fielded in FY 2021.
